lines.text: After the Manchurian Incident the militarists attempted to unify domestic opinions in order to realize their ambition to invade Asia. They denounced as "Red" any ideology that might hinder their policy. Professors and students fought the suppression. The Kyoto University Disturbance was one of their struggles for freedom.
I like the smell of earth. It's wonderful.
I like the sky.
I like the wind.
I like everything.
I can see the university. Kyoto University, the garden of freedom! The glorious tower! Mecca for students!

[Machine gun fire in the distance]
I can see the soldiers. They're so small. I like the sound. It's clear and rhythmical.
I don't think the world is full of only logic. There must be beautiful, pleasant things.
Why not listen to me seriously? The world you know is limited to this room. Surrounded by flatterers. Maybe you need a slap in the face to grow up.
Beauty without logic is nothing but bubbles.
Listen, Itokawa. Sit down. Kowtow and apologize to me.
Why?
No questions! Do it. Please do. Do it now! Quickly. Quickly. Do it now! Quickly. Quickly.
[Itokawa starts to bow]
What are you doing? Don't do it. Forget it. Forget it.
I'm a janitor, but I'll fight for freedom, too.
Frankly, I love Mr. Noge. If I were a girl, I'd marry you.
Unfortunately, we lost this time. But, Justice will triumph. That's certain. Flowers withered this year. But when Spring returns, they will bloom again.
No matter what hardship may befall you. You must try to learn something from it. That is important.
If I follow you, my life will be peaceful. But, if I may say so -
[bows]
It'll be boring.
With Noge?
If I follow him, something dazzling will await me. My life will be stormy.
[laughs]
It terrifies me and fascinates me.
Are you sure you can support yourself?
I studied English and typing. I'll work for a trading company. I'll become independent.
I'm bored. I'm disgusted. I want to start my life over again.
It's not easy. The world isn't a garden.
I know. Now I feel my life is meaningless. I want to go out in the world and see what it is like to live.

If you're determined, then go. Make your own way, groping and struggling. It's worth a try. But remember, you're responsible for what you do. Freedom. You must fight for it. There will be sacrifice and torture in the struggle. Be prepared.
His way of life is astonishing. He's walking on a wall.
"There will be sacrifice in the struggle for freedom." I want to do something in which I can consume myself.
That's not easy. How does one find such a job? It's like finding a bluebird.
I was afraid of this. Our path is so steep.
It's all right. I won't mind.
"No regrets in my life." That's our motto. No matter how hard it may be, I like the way we live. I've found meaning in my life.
When did you start living with Noge? When did you become his woman?
Look at the clouds! Do you remember?
The picnic to Mt. Yoshida? We were young.
We work after dark, like owls.
No regrets in my life. No regrets whatsoever.
I don't want you to live in a place like this. Noge took the wrong way. But you shouldn't.
[laughs]
All right. You beat me. Your zeal is amazing. Your passion for life makes me feel small.
A prosecutor may think Noge was wrong. But who can tell which was greater, you or him? Time is a slow but fair judge.
You were born to suffer.
"No regrets in my life." I'm glad I can feel it now.
